pages.privacy-policy: Privacy Policy - RollGear: Your Privacy Matters to Us 18+ RollGear Home The best products Choose us The pursuit of excellence Join Contact Write us Privacy Policy We employ reasonable measures to safeguard your personal information against unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. Despite our efforts, please be aware that no method of data transmission over the internet or electronic storage is entirely secure. Therefore, we cannot guarantee the absolute security of any information you transmit to us, and you do so at your own risk. During transmission, we utilize industry-standard encryption technologies such as SSL/TLS to protect your personal information. Our systems are further fortified with firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, and other security protocols to uphold the integrity and security of our data. Access to your personal information is restricted to authorized personnel, including employees, contractors, and service providers, who require access for operational purposes and are bound by confidentiality obligations.We continuously review and enhance our security measures to mitigate risks and ensure the protection of your personal information. Your Rights and Choices You have certain rights and choices regarding the personal information we collect and how we use it. These include: Right to Access, Update, or Delete: You have the right to access, update, or request deletion of your personal information held by us. This ensures that the information we hold about you is accurate and current. Right to Opt Out of Marketing Communications: You have the right to opt out of receiving marketing communications from us at any time. You can usually do this through the preferences or unsubscribe link in the marketing communication itself, or by contacting us directly. Right to Restrict or Object to Processing: You have the right to request restrictions on or object to the processing of your personal information under certain circumstances. This includes situations where you believe the processing is unlawful or no longer necessary for the purposes for which it was collected. Right to Data Portability: You have the right to receive a copy of your personal information in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format, and to transmit those data to another data controller where technically feasible. Right to Withdraw Consent: If we rely on your consent to process your personal information, you have the right to withdraw that consent at any time. This will not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal. International Data Transfers We may transfer your personal information to countries outside of your country of residence, including the Australia, where our servers are located. These countries may have different data protection laws than your country of residence. However, we will take appropriate measures to protect your personal information in accordance with this Privacy Policy and applicable law. Australian Privacy Rights If you are a Australian resident, you have certain rights under the Australian Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). These rights include: The right to know what personal information we collect, use, disclose, and sell The right to request deletion of your personal information The right to opt out of the sale of your personal information The right to non-discrimination for exercising your CCPA rights Do Not Track Some web browsers have a "Do Not Track" feature that allows users to indicate their preference not to be tracked across websites. However, we do not currently respond to Do Not Track signals. How We Share Your Personal Information We may share your personal information with third-party service providers who help us operate our business, such as payment processors, shipping carriers, and marketing service providers. We may also share your information with our affiliates and subsidiaries for internal business purposes. We may disclose your personal information to law enforcement or other government authorities as required by law or to protect our legal rights. We may also disclose your personal information in connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of our business. We do not sell or rent your personal information to third parties for their own marketing purposes. Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies We use cookies and other tracking technologies to collect information about your browsing activity on our website. This information helps us improve our website and provide a more personalized experience for our users. Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. We use both session cookies, which expire when you close your browser, and persistent cookies, which remain on your device until you delete them. We use the following types of cookies: Essential cookies: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be disabled. Functional cookies: These cookies allow us to remember your preferences and settings, such as your language or login information. Analytical cookies: These cookies allow us to collect information about how you use our website, such as which pages you visit and how long you stay on them. Marketing cookies: These cookies allow us to track your browsing activity and provide you with targeted advertising based on your interests. You can manage your cookie preferences through your browser settings. However, please note that disabling cookies may affect the functionality of our website. Contact Us If you have any questions or concerns about our Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us at rollgear@gmail.com. We will do our best to address your inquiry in a timely and satisfactory manner. RollGear Transforming casinos worldwide - RollGear.
